result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kevin M. Murphy was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Kevin M. Murphy was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
Two days sentence credit if revoked.

See plea hearing on 6/7/22 as to the details of the waiver.

10:12 AM cases 19CF1581 and 22CF319 called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kevin M. Murphy in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Kevin M. Murphy. In 19CF1581: State moves to dismiss- So ordered. 
In 22CF319: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to Counts 1 and 2 as charged in the criminal complaint. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
Defendant makes a statement before sentencing. 
As to Count 1: Court withholds sentence and places defendant on Probation for 3 years with conditions: 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. 
No entry to bars liquor stores or taverns or any place that primarily serves alcohol. 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.
Pay court costs including the DNA sample surcharge. Defendant has two days credit if revoked from Probation. 
As to Count 2: Court orders 80 days in jail (2 days credit) with Huber. 
Pay $2502.00 (fine + costs) and the Mayo blood draw fee. 
Defendant's license is revoked for 27 months and must install an IID for 27 months after license is reinstated. 
Defendant to complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant is eligible for 1/2 priced IID.

(9:41 AM cases 22CF319, 19CF1581 called.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kevin M. Murphy does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Kevin M. Murphy. 
Attorney Rivard advises there is a DAGP case of 19CF1581 which is possibly being revoked.
Attorney Rivard advises hasn't had contact with the defendant. 
Attorney Rivard requests new date.
Clerk advises case 19CF1581 is scheduled for an Order to Show Cause Hearing in Branch 3.
Court notes will schedule case 22CF319 for a new hearing in intake court.
Hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

(11:23 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kevin M. Murphy appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Katherine Cook for Kevin M. Murphy appeared by video. 
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant updates address with the Court.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on April 4, 2022 at 1:45 pm.
Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
